S(kim) - Service Kommunikation Information Medien Dokumentation: Funknetzwerk (WLAN) TH OWL S(kim) Documentation Wireless network eduroam Linux To set up the "eduroam" wireless network, you need the following things in advance: Internet access - depending on your location, there are three ways to access the Internet: Via the free wireless network "Conference & Guests" at all three university locations Via internet access with your smartphone (tethering) From home via your own internet access (DSL) Your user certificate - You can find out how to obtain this certificate (EduCert.p12) with the help of the above Internet access in the user certificate documentation referred to here. Open the configuration for the WLAN networks on the Linux system, which can usually be opened via the context menu in the status bar. Note - The menus may look different. If you encounter any problems, you are welcome to contact us. Select the WLAN "eduroam" there and start the further configuration via the "Connect" button: Wifi-Security - For connection security, please use "WPA & WPA2-Enterprise" and "TLS" as authentication Identity - As the access authorization is defined via the certificate, you only n

nnect" button: Wifi-Security - For connection security, please use "WPA & WPA2-Enterprise" and "TLS" as authentication Identity - As the access authorization is defined via the certificate, you only need to ensure that the domain "th-owl.de" is used under "Identity". We recommend entering "anonymous@th-owl.de". User certificate - For the "User certificate" field, click on the field, select "Load from file" and select the downloaded user certificate "EduCert.p12". Private user key - The "Private key" field is filled in automatically. Password of the privat key - The required password is identical to your IDM password at the time of certificate creation. Checkbox - Activate the property "CA certificate is not required". Save settings - Save these settings using the "Connect" button, which also establishes the connection to Eduroam.

S(kim) - Service Kommunikation Information Medien Dokumentation: Funknetzwerk (WLAN) TH OWL S(kim) Dokumentation Funknetzwerk eduroam Linux Für die Einrichtung des Funknetzwerk " eduroam " benötigen Sie vorab die folgenden Dinge: Einen Zugang zum Internet - Diesen erhalten Sie je nach Standort über drei Möglichkeiten: Über das freie Funknetzwerk " Conference & Guests " an allen drei Standorten der Hochschule Über einen Internetzugang mit Ihrem Smartphone (Tethering) Von zu Hause über Ihren eigenen Internetzugang (DSL) Ihr Hochschulzertifikat - Wie Sie dieses Zertifikat (EduCert.p12) erhalten, erfahren Sie mit Hilfe des obigen Internetzugangs in der hier verwiesenen Dokumentation Hochschulzertifikat . Anwendung starten Eingabe Anwendung starten Öffnen Sie auf dem Linux-System die Konfigurations-Anwendung für die WLAN-Netzwerke, die sich üblicherweise über das Kontextmenü in der Statusleiste öffnen lässt. Wählen Sie dort die WLAN-ESSID "eduroam" aus und starten Sie die weitere Konfiguration über die Schaltfläche "Verbinden": Eingabe Wifi-Security - Für die Verbindungs-Sicherheit verwenden Sie bitte "WPA- & WPA2-Enterprise" und als Legitimierung "TLS" Identity - Da die Zugangsberechti

ion über die Schaltfläche "Verbinden": Eingabe Wifi-Security - Für die Verbindungs-Sicherheit verwenden Sie bitte "WPA- & WPA2-Enterprise" und als Legitimierung "TLS" Identity - Da die Zugangsberechtigung über das Zertifikat festgelegt wird, ist unter "Identität" lediglich darauf zu achten, dass die Domäne "th-owl.de" verwendet wird. Wir empfehlen, "anonymous@th-owl.de" einzutragen. User-Zertifikat - Für das Feld "User-Zertifikat" klicken Sie auf das Feld, wählen Sie "Aus Datei laden" und wählen Sie das heruntergeladene Benutzerzertifikat " EduCert.p12 " aus. Geheimer User-Schlüssel - Das Feld "Geheimer Schlüssel" wird dabei automatisch gefüllt. Passwort des User-Schlüssels - Das benötigte Passwort ist identisch mit Ihrem IDM-Passwort zu dem Zeitpunkt der Zertifikatserstellung. Checkbox - Aktivieren Sie die Eigenschaft "CA-Zertifikat ist nicht erforderlich". Einstellungen sichern - Speichern Sie diese Einstellungen über die Schaltfläche "Verbinden", womit auch die Verbindung zum Eduroam hergestellt wird.

S(kim) - Service Kommunikation Information Medien Dokumentation: CampusCard (KISOWL) TH OWL S(kim) Documentation CampusCard (KISOWL) The CampusCard (KISOWL) is a multifunctional chip card that is issued to all university members on application. The name of the card is derived from the three profiles of the study campuses (Kreativ Innovativ Sustainable). The CampusCard (KISOWL) fulfills the following purposes: Library card: borrowing, renewing and returning books at the Service-Point or at the self-service checkout or rebooking at the Service-Point Electronic wallet: Pay in the cafeterias of the Studierendenwerk Bielefeld; pay fees at the S(kim) Service-Point or the load-up terminals. Access / locking authorization: Gradually, all TH OWL doors will be equipped with locking cylinders that can be used with the card. Print management: Employees can use their card to collect their print jobs from the print management multifunction devices Visual identification card with photo: This is used for identification, for example by the security service, which checks the buildings in the evening. Good to know: Here you can find a screencast that explains how to apply for the CampusCard Link to a

for identification, for example by the security service, which checks the buildings in the evening. Good to know: Here you can find a screencast that explains how to apply for the CampusCard Link to a screencast for applying for the CampusCard Target Group - Whom is the CampusCard for? Applictaion - Here you will find instructions for the initial and subsequent application and information on validity, renewal and validation.. Pick-up, Activation - Here you can find out where you can pick up your CampusCard and how to activate it. Validation, Reactivation - Here we show you how you can validate or reactivate your card at the start of the semester using self-service. Usage - Here we explain how to pay with your KISOWL and use the library services, for example.. Blocking the card - Here you can find out how to block your KISOWL. Returns, Remaining credit - Here you can find out how to return your KISOWL and how you can have any remaining credit refunded. In the German version there is a reference to data protection. The CampusCard (KISOWL) always serves as an electronic wallet. Depending on the group of people, it also fulfills other purposes. (Guest) Students of the TH OWL - ID card

eference to data protection. The CampusCard (KISOWL) always serves as an electronic wallet. Depending on the group of people, it also fulfills other purposes. (Guest) Students of the TH OWL - ID card and library card, locking authorization (Event) Guests of the TH OWL University of Applied Sciences - ID card, locking authorization Regular employees of the TH OWL - ID card and library card, locking authorization. Temporary employees, Guests such as interns, consultants, employees for short-term projects - ID card and library card, locking authorization. External library users - library card, locking authorization and library card External service providers such as cleaners, tradesmen, employees of construction companies - library card, locking authorization Please note that it is not permitted to pass on your CampusCard (KISOWL) to third parties. Admission requirements To apply for your KISOWL, you need a valid user account for the IDM (Identity-Management-System) of TH OWL. You can find all information on this in the S(kim) documentation system in the Guide to the IDM: Link to the Documentation Initial application To apply for your KISOWL, you must register in the IDM, upload a pho

d all information on this in the S(kim) documentation system in the Guide to the IDM: Link to the Documentation Initial application To apply for your KISOWL, you must register in the IDM, upload a photo, specify the pick-up location ("Abholort") and send the application. The following is a step-by-step guide on how to submit the initial application for your KISOWL and upload the required photo: The way to the card application Login - Call up the URL https://idm.th-owl.de/ in the web browser and log in with your access data for the user access (IDM) of the university. A second factor is also required to log in. Instructions on how to set up two-factor authentication can be found here in our documentation on two-factor authentication. Link to the S(kim) documentation: Two-Factor-Authentication Applications - Select the "Applications Area ("Anwendungen") Action selection - Click on "CampusCard (KISOWL)" in the following menu. Employees select "CampusCard (KISOWL) V2" IMPORTANT! After clicking, a new browser window or a new tab opens. However, if a pop-up blocker is active, you must first deactivate it by allowing pop-ups for idm.th-owl.de. Submit and manage initial application Overvie

king, a new browser window or a new tab opens. However, if a pop-up blocker is active, you must first deactivate it by allowing pop-ups for idm.th-owl.de. Submit and manage initial application Overview - The overview of your CampusCard (KISOWL) appears in the new browser window. Personal data - First check your personal data here: Name, matriculation number, library number. Card status - Here you will also find the card status, which is set to "First-time CampusCard (KISOWL) application". Upload photo - Click on "Hier klicken: Laden Sie HIER Ihr Lichtbild hoch". The web interface will open where you can select your photo. Before you can use the photo, you must ensure that your face is centered and positioned in the specified frame. You can move the frame, rotate the image and adjust the brightness, contrast or saturation. Please note the warning messages above your light image. Important: Please make sure that your photo is free of third-party rights. Please also take into account our guidelines for a suitable photo. For employees who want to apply for a card without a photo, it is also sufficient to check the "Antrag ohne Lichtbild" (engl.=>Application without photo) box and then

guidelines for a suitable photo. For employees who want to apply for a card without a photo, it is also sufficient to check the "Antrag ohne Lichtbild" (engl.=>Application without photo) box and then confirm the note Pick-up location for students in Lemgo, Detmold or Höxter: Use the drop-down menu "Abholort" (engl. => Pick-up location) o select the university location where you want to pick up your KISOWL. Your CampusCard (KISOWL) will be issued to you at Service-Points at the libraries. Please bring a valid identification document (identity card, passport or residence permit) with you when you collect your card. Pick-up location ("Abholort") for students in Herford: We produce the CampusCards for students studiyning in Herford in Lemgo and bring them to the various events in Herford by arrangement. Therefore, please select the pick-up location Lemgo. Of course you can also pick up the card in person, simply select the pick-up location that is easiest for you to reach. Final check - Check the data you have entered: Is the name, matriculation number and library number correct? Do you really want to use the selected photograph for your KISOWL? Does your chosen photo meet our requirem

eck the data you have entered: Is the name, matriculation number and library number correct? Do you really want to use the selected photograph for your KISOWL? Does your chosen photo meet our requirements? Submit data - If all details are correct, check the ""Alle Daten korrekt" (engl. => all data correct) box and click the "Senden" (eng.=> submit) button. Congratulations - you have successfully submitted the initial application for your CampusCard (KISOWL). You will receive an e-mail confirming receipt of your initial application. Gut zu wissen Use of the library for employees - If required, employees must apply to use the library once. This is very easy to do in IDM under the application menu item "Library services". Follow-up application ("Folgeantrag") You can only submit a follow-up application after your CampusCard (KISOWL) has been definitively blocked. There are many reasons for this, some of which are subject to a fee: Loss (subject to a fee) Change of name on marriage (not subject to a fee) Expired validity (not chargeable) Physical defect (chargeable depending on whether the card has been handled with care) To submit a subsequent application, proceed as for the "initial

bject to a fee) Expired validity (not chargeable) Physical defect (chargeable depending on whether the card has been handled with care) To submit a subsequent application, proceed as for the "initial application". Guest-card for external guests If you are not a member of TH OWL, you can still use our libraries. In this case, the KISOWL serves exclusively as a guest library card. This is free of charge for you and is already included in the annual fee for using the library. To obtain a guest library card, proceed as follows: (1) Registration Register for the IDM yourself You can use the freely accessible workstations in the library for this purpose You can find instructions on how to proceed here: Self-registration for external useres (2) Activation At the respective S(kim) Service-Point of the location Validation (verification of identity) A valid identification document is required (identity card/passport/residence permit) (3) Take a photo At the respective S(kim)-Service-Point of the location Sign the declaration of consent The ID card is then produced on site Photograph specifications When uploading the image, only the technical requirements are checked. You are responsible for

location Sign the declaration of consent The ID card is then produced on site Photograph specifications When uploading the image, only the technical requirements are checked. You are responsible for ensuring that you are clearly recognizable in the picture. If you require a follow-up card due to a poor image, you will be responsible for the costs of this card (12 Euro). Good Not okay JPEG file, minimum size (H x W) 600 x 450 pixels. This is the minimum size after cropping the image. Images larger than 10 MB Illustration only by yourself Reflective lenses/sunglasses Looking straight into the camera Headgear that covers the face Selfie, passport photo Scans of driver's license, ID card or other identification documents Large, clearly recognizable image of your face The road to your CampusCard (KISOWL) Production Pick-up Validation and activation The road to your CampusCard (KISOWL) After you have submitted your initial or follow-up application for your KISOWL, it goes through further stages on its way to you: production, pick-up, validation and activation and finally release. Production The "CampusCard (KISOWL)" web interface shows you the card status "CampusCard (KISOWL) wird produ

ages on its way to you: production, pick-up, validation and activation and finally release. Production The "CampusCard (KISOWL)" web interface shows you the card status "CampusCard (KISOWL) wird produziert" ("CampusCard (KISOWL) being produced") . As long as this card status is displayed, you will have to wait and check your e-mails regularly. As soon as your KISOWL has been produced, you will receive an e-mail. The card status displayed will change to "CampusCard (KISOWL) zur Abholung bereit" ("CampusCard (KISOWL) ready for pick-up"). Pick-up Follow the instructions in the e-mail you received. Please note: The time listed. The opening hours of the Service Point in the library. The specified pick-up location ("Abholort"). The documents listed for identity verification (validation). Go to the Service-Point in the library at the specified pick-up location. Validation and activation In order to activate your KISOWL, your identity must be verified and your data compared. The quality of your KISOWL is also checked. This entire process is referred to below as validation. Procedure for validation/activation Present your ID card, passport or residence permit at the Service Point. Your iden

r KISOWL is also checked. This entire process is referred to below as validation. Procedure for validation/activation Present your ID card, passport or residence permit at the Service Point. Your identity will be validated, the quality and accuracy of your photo will be checked and the match with the data in the IDM will be confirmed. Validation is successful. Receive your KISOWL and your ID card, passport or residence permit. You will receive an e-mail confirming successful validation and that your KISOWL has been issued to you. The card status displayed in the IDM will change to "CampusCard (KISOWL) issued". Your KISOWL is activated. If you pick up a follow-up card, you may have to pay an additional €12 fee General information Students must validate their CampusCard (KISOWL) at the beginning of each semester. Successful validation is a prerequisite for being able to eat at reduced prices in the canteen. There is a grace period after the chip card expires, which allows you to pay. Good to know: No credit can be loaded onto a non-validated CampusCard (KISOWL). Neither in the cafeteria nor at the revaluator! However, you can still pay library fees with your chip card. Employees of t

d to know: No credit can be loaded onto a non-validated CampusCard (KISOWL). Neither in the cafeteria nor at the revaluator! However, you can still pay library fees with your chip card. Employees of the TH OWL do not need to validate their card. You can perform the validation here You can carry out the validation at a so-called revaluator. You will find these devices at the following locations: Campus Lemgo Main building, passageway to the library Höxter campus in front of the library Detmold campus in front of the canteen Validating the card Insert your CampusCard (KISOWL) into the revaluator. Select "Validate chip card". You will receive confirmation that your card has been successfully validated The revaluator will automatically issue your chip card. If validation is not successful, the following message will appear on the display of the revaluator: "Your KISOWL could not be validated, please check your re-registration". If you have already transferred the semester fee, you can contact the Enrolment Office or visit the Service Point at the respective location in the event of a technical fault General information Top up credit Library Locking system Print management Cafeteria Gen

act the Enrolment Office or visit the Service Point at the respective location in the event of a technical fault General information Top up credit Library Locking system Print management Cafeteria General information Your CampusCard (KISOWL) not only serves as a visual ID, but you can also use it to pay in the cafeteria, use library services or use the print management for staff. In addition, the CampusCard replaces the key ring in the university's new locking system. Please note that it is not permitted to pass on your CampusCard (KISOWL) to third parties. Top up credit Top up and view credit at the load-up terminal ("Aufwerter") Insert your KISOWL into the card slot under the "Chip card" lettering. Your chip card data (card balance; validity of student status) Tap "Upgrade chip card". Select one of the 6 suggested amounts. A free selection of the amount is not possible. Click on "Upgrade chip card" at the bottom right Insert your Girocard into the card slot under "girocard". Enter your PIN using the PIN pad. Confirm your entry with the "Best" button. The successful process is confirmed via the display on the PIN pad. Remove your girocard. IMPORTANT! If you need a receipt, do not

ur PIN using the PIN pad. Confirm your entry with the "Best" button. The successful process is confirmed via the display on the PIN pad. Remove your girocard. IMPORTANT! If you need a receipt, do not remove your card yet. Tap "Yes. Print receipt" on the screen of the load-up terminal. You can then remove your KISOWL and your receipt. Library The KISOWL replaces the previous library card. You can use it to borrow media from the library and manage your user account You have two options for borrowing media with your KISOWL: At the service points in the libraries ( during service hours ). About the self-checkout machine in the libraries ("Selbstverbucher") You can use the self-checkout machine during the library's opening hours for functions such as borrowing, returning, renewing and accessing user account information. When prompted, hold your CampusCard (KISOWL) up to the reader unit provided for this purpose. Calling up functions via the touchscreen of the self-service check-out machine Follow the instructions on the screen. Good to know: Library fees can no longer be paid in cash. Simply use your CampusCard and pay the fees at one of the load-up terminals. Locking system The locking

Follow the instructions on the screen. Good to know: Library fees can no longer be paid in cash. Simply use your CampusCard and pay the fees at one of the load-up terminals. Locking system The locking cylinders, which could previously be operated with key chips, will gradually be converted to the CampusCard (KISOWL). At the start of the changeover, the barrier system to the employee parking lot in Detmold will be lockable with the CampusCard. In the long term, almost all locking authorizations will be processed via the card. This applies to employees and students. Print management With the CampusCard (KISOWL), you can pick up your printouts or make scans and copies from any multifunctional device that is assigned to the TH OWL print management system. You can find more information on this in our instructions on this topic: S(kim)-Documentation Print management ("Druckmanagement") Cafeteria Place your CampusCard (KISOWL) on the card reader. Your cards will remain on the card reader until the payment process is complete. Good to know: It is not possible to pay with the KISOWL in the cafeteria at the Herford campus. General information Block the card yourself Have the card blocked Gen

l the payment process is complete. Good to know: It is not possible to pay with the KISOWL in the cafeteria at the Herford campus. General information Block the card yourself Have the card blocked General information If you have lost your CampusCard (KISOWL), you should block it. On the one hand, no one can borrow media from the library on your account, and on the other hand, any credit cannot be used by others in the Cafeteria. You have to make a decision when blocking the card: Temporary block ("vorläufige Sperre): T he card is initially blocked for 36 hours. If your card reappears within this time, it can be reactivated. The advantage: In this case, no fees are charged. At the end of the 36 hours, the card is automatically blocked permanently. You cannot apply for a new card during the temporary blocking period. Permanent block ("endgültige Sperre"): The card can no longer be used and can no longer be reactivated. You can immediately apply for a new card, which may be subject to a fee. Block the card yourself You can block your card at any time in self-service via the Identity Management (IDM). You can use this option outside our service hours, for example. Open the website for

ee. Block the card yourself You can block your card at any time in self-service via the Identity Management (IDM). You can use this option outside our service hours, for example. Open the website for your user access in the IDM (https://idm.th-owl.de) Log in with your user name and password. A second factor is also required to log in. Instructions on how to set up two-factor authentication can be found here in our documentation on two-factor authentication. Link to the S(kim) documentation: "Two factor authentication" (Zwei-Faktor-Authentifizierung) The start screen of your user account in IDM appears. Click on "Application" ("Anwendung"). Your Dashboard will appear. Click on "CampusCard (KISOWL)". You can block your CampusCard (KISOWL) temporarily ("vorläufig") or permanently ("endgültig") i.e. irrevocably, in the following web interface. Check the box as required. If you do not report your KISOWL as found or it is not reported as found within the next 36 hours, it will automatically be blocked permanently. Click on "Send" ("senden"). Have the card blocked If you are unable or do not wish to block the library independently, please proceed as follows: Go to the service point in the

be blocked permanently. Click on "Send" ("senden"). Have the card blocked If you are unable or do not wish to block the library independently, please proceed as follows: Go to the service point in the respective library. Tell the service employee about your problem. The facts and functionality of the chip card will be checked. The Service Point employee can block the chip card temporarily or irrevocably according to your wishes. The card status displayed in the IDM will change accordingly. Depending on the result, the service employee will initiate further measures and give you instructions on how to proceed. The card status in the IDM may change again. Rückgabe der Karte As soon as your studies or employment have ended, you must return the CampusCard, as it is the property of TH OWL. You can return the card directly to one of our Service-Points. The card will be blocked immediately upon return. Alternatively, you can return the card by post to the following address: Technische Hochschule Ostwestfalen Lippe S(kim) Campusallee 12 32756 Lemgo It is best to block your card before sending it to avoid misuse. Reimbursement of the remaining balance If you still have credit on your card a

ule Ostwestfalen Lippe S(kim) Campusallee 12 32756 Lemgo It is best to block your card before sending it to avoid misuse. Reimbursement of the remaining balance If you still have credit on your card after the end of your studies or employment, you can have this refunded as follows: Send an eMail to the "Studierendenwerk" with your card number (e.g. 5000xxxxxx) and your bank account details and a request to transfer the balance. Good to know: The card must be blocked in advance. It can take up to 5 working days to refund the credit. E-Mail: support@th-owl.de Phone: +49 5261 702-2222

S(kim) - Service Kommunikation Information Medien Dokumentation: Studierendenportal TH OWL S(kim) Documentation Student Portal Please note: The student portal has been discontinued, as examination registration and viewing will be possible in the KIS portal in future. However, this portal will remain accessible for some time so that you can compare your achievements with the entries in the KIS portal. The documentation below will no longer be updated. The Student Portal is the central point of contact for organising your examinations and obtaining documents as proof. The following points and functionalities can be found here: Registering for and cancelling exams Inspection of grades for examinations taken Download certificate of grades (PDF) The following chapters explain how to access the portal. Internal operation is not currently available: Installation - Here we explain how to set up your web browser to access the Student Portal URL. Login/Logout - Here you will find support for login in and login out on the Student Portal. Note: To register and use the examination portal, you need the User Certificate . E-Mail: support@th-owl.de Phone: +49 5261 702-2222
in in and login out on the Student Portal. Note: To register and use the examination portal, you need the User Certificate . E-Mail: support@th-owl.de Phone: +49 5261 702-2222

S(kim) - Service Kommunikation Information Medien Dokumentation: Studierendenportal TH OWL S(kim) Documentation Student Portal Login/Logout on the Student Portal You can access the Student Portal using a web browser by entering the following URL: https://www.th-owl.de/studi/ Please check before registration Do you have a valid university certificate? - If you do not yet have a university certificate, the following link will tell you how to obtain one: Obtaining a university certificate: Obtaining a user certifiacte Is the university certificate installed in the web browser you are using? - If you have not yet installed a valid user certificate in your web browser, first go to the Setup chapter in Installatio n. Are you enrolled or have you re-enrolled correctly? - Enrolment/re-enrolment in a degree programme at the university is valid. If you have not re-enrolled in the current semester or have been de-registered, you cannot use the online portal. Does the web browser you are using accept cookies from the Student Portal? - The Student Portal cookies must also be accepted for correct operation after logging in. Are any firewall settings blocking access to the Student Portal website?

ept cookies from the Student Portal? - The Student Portal cookies must also be accepted for correct operation after logging in. Are any firewall settings blocking access to the Student Portal website? - Locally installed security software (e.g. Kasperski Internet Security or similar) must allow access to the Student Portal URL in the web browser. You may need to add the URL of the Student Portal https://secure.th-owl.de to the trusted sites in your security software The Student Portal login screen After accessing the Student Portal pages, you will be asked to enter your password. The user name is already pre-assigned from the data of the installed university certificate and cannot be changed. If you have any questions about your university user access (user name & password), you will find information in the following documentation: Identity Management Your functions If the access data is incorrect, the message "Login failed" will appear below the login screen. In this case, please check whether the usage requirements are all met and, if necessary, contact an S(kim) service point at your location for clarification. Alternatively, you can also send an e-mail to support@th-owl.de with

k whether the usage requirements are all met and, if necessary, contact an S(kim) service point at your location for clarification. Alternatively, you can also send an e-mail to support@th-owl.de with details such as matriculation number, time of the login attempt, web browser used and, if possible, the node designation (e.g. Node2) from the imprint bar. Once you have successfully registered, you will be taken to the Student Portal where you can access numerous functions. The safety instructions As soon as all actions have been carried out, you can log out regularly using the "Logout" function at the top left. A security notice will appear after logging out. You should follow this in your own interest. After logging out, please read the notice. You can log in to the Student Portal again via the "Home" button.

S(kim) - Service Kommunikation Information Medien Dokumentation: Studierendenportal TH OWL S(kim) Dokumentation Studierendenportal An-/Abmeldung Das Studierendenportal erreichen Sie mit Hilfe eines Webbrowser unter Angabe des folgenden URLs: https://www.th-owl.de/studi/ Bitte vor der Anmeldung prüfen Besitzen Sie ein gültiges Hochschulzertifikat? - Sollten Sie darüber hinaus noch kein Hochschulzertifikat besitzen, erfahren in dem folgenden Verweis wie Sie es beschaffen und werden anschließend auch in diese Dokumentation zurück verwiesen: Beschaffung des Hochschulzertifikats Ist das Hochschulzertifikat im verwendeten Webbrowser installiert? - Sollten Sie an dieser Stelle noch kein gültiges Hochschulzertifikat im Webbrowser installiert haben, gehen Sie in dieser Dokumentation zunächst in das Kapitel Einrichtung . Sind Sie eingeschrieben oder haben Sie sich korrekt wieder zurückgemeldet? - Die Einschreibung/Rückmeldung an der Hochschule in einen Studiengang ist gültig. Sofern eine Rückmeldung in das aktuell laufende Semester nicht erfolgt ist bzw. eine Exmatrikulation ausgesprochen wurde, kann das Onlineportal nicht genutzt werden. Akzeptiert Ihr verwendeter Webbrowser Cookies vom Stu

dung in das aktuell laufende Semester nicht erfolgt ist bzw. eine Exmatrikulation ausgesprochen wurde, kann das Onlineportal nicht genutzt werden. Akzeptiert Ihr verwendeter Webbrowser Cookies vom Studierendenportal? - Ebenfalls müssen für den korrekten Betrieb nach der Anmeldung die Cookies des Studierendenportals akzeptiert werden. Blockieren ggf. Firewalleinstellungen den Aufruf der Webseiten des Studierendenportals? - Lokal installierte Sicherheits-Software (z.B. Kasperski Internet Security o.ä.) muss den Zugriff im Webbrowser auf den URL des Studierendenportals gestatten. Ggf. müssen Sie den URL des Studierendenportals https://secure.th-owl.de in Ihrer Sicherheits-Software zu den Vertrauenswürdigen Seiten hinzufügen. Die Anmeldemaske des Studierendenportals Nach dem Aufruf der Seiten des Studierendenportals wird zur Eingabe des Passwortes aufgefordert. Der Benutzername wird bereits aus den Daten des installierten Hochschulzertifikats vorbelegt und ist nicht änderbar. Sollten Sie Fragen zu Ihrem Hochschulbenutzerzugang (Benutzername & Passwort) haben, finden Sie Informationen in der folgenden Dokumentation: Benutzerzugang Ihre Funktionen Sollten die Zugangsdaten nicht korrekt s

ragen zu Ihrem Hochschulbenutzerzugang (Benutzername & Passwort) haben, finden Sie Informationen in der folgenden Dokumentation: Benutzerzugang Ihre Funktionen Sollten die Zugangsdaten nicht korrekt sein, erscheint unterhalb der Anmeldemaske die Meldung "Anmeldung fehlgeschlagen". Bitte prüfen Sie in diesem Fall, ob die Nutzungsvoraussetzungen alle erfüllt sind und wenden Sie sich ggf. zur Klärung an einen S(kim)-Servicepoints an Ihrem Standort. Alternativ können Sie auch gerne eine E-Mail an support@th-owl.de mit Angaben wie Matrikelnummer, Zeit des Anmeldeversuchs, verwendeter Webbrowser und wenn möglich die Node–Bezeichnung (Bsp. Node2) von der Impressum-Leiste. Nach erfolgreicher Anmeldung gelangen Sie in das Studierendenportal in denen Ihnen zahlreiche Funktionen zur Verfügung stehen. Die Sicherheitshinweise Sobald sämtliche Aktionen durchgeführt wurden, können Sie sich über die "Logout" Funktion links oben regulär abmelden. Es erscheint nach dem Logout noch ein Sicherheitshinweis. Diesen sollten Sie in Ihrem eigenen Interesse befolgen. Nach dem Logout lesen Sie sich bitte den Hinweis durch. Über den Button "Home" können Sie sich erneut am Studierendenportal anmelden.

Technische Hochschule Ostwestfalen-Lippe 16.05.2025 Examination Board Exam registration for exams in the summer semester 2025 Examination period (PZ): PZ3: 02.06.25 – 15.06.25 PZ4: 18.08.25 – 31.08.25 In order to take part in the exams, you must register for the exams in advance. It is not possible to take part in the exams without prior registration. Registration for the examinations takes place via the KIS portal. Different registration modalities: Bachelor's degree program in Medical and Health Technology: Update 28.05.25: Exam registration will take place for all exams in the above-mentioned periods.
